p: Viral clearance was confirmed by serial RT‐PCR of samples from throat swabs; clearance was defined as having at least two consecutive negative results for swabs collected 24 hours apart. The virus clearance time was calculated from the onset of symptoms to the date of the first negative RT‐PCR test. Clinical recovery was determined by the attending physicians by integrating information about clinical manifestations, laboratory test results, and radiological results. Patients were characterised as having received corticosteroids if they received at least one dose during their hospital stay.
